title: Our simulated trade market for A.J. Brown: Which teams should be interested in the star WR?
content: Brown could get traded this offseason. Could Buffalo be a good fit? Baltimore? Let's project his market with four offers and a verdict.

title: 32 candidates to get cut, traded and passed over this offseason: Names to watch
content: Let's pick out players who could use a change of scenery for the 2026 season, including David Montgomery.

title: Crosby 'by no means' out of Games, Cooper says
content: Canada is taking Sidney Crosby's injury "day by day," coach Jon Cooper said, as the team prepares for its Olympic semifinal against Finland.

title: Peterson's cramping exit draws Self's concern
content: Kansas freshman Darryn Peterson was limited to just the first three minutes of the second half against Oklahoma State with a cramping issue that coach Bill Self called concerning.

title: 'Just relief': U.S. survives OT thriller to reach semis
content: The U.S. men are moving on to the semifinals at the Olympics thanks to Quinn Hughes, after needing extra hockey to get through the quarterfinals Wednesday against Sweden.

title: Rousey, Carano set for extensive testing for clash
content: Ronda Rousey and Gina Carano will undergo extensive medical and neurological testing ahead of their May 16 MMA comeback clash, according to the California State Athletic Commission.

title: Flagg's Mavericks debut jersey sells for $1 million
content: The jersey worn by Cooper Flagg in the first half of his NBA debut has been sold for $1 million, a record for a collectible of the Mavericks rookie.

title: Report: Hornets' Ball uninjured after car crash
content: LaMelo Ball was not injured after being involved in a two-car crash in downtown Charlotte on Wednesday, a source told The Associated Press.

title: Creighton's Dix stars vs. UConn after mom's death
content: Josh Dix scored 21 points to lead Creighton to a 91-84 win over No. 5 UConn on Wednesday night, two weeks after his mother died from colon cancer.

title: MLBPA elevates Meyer after Clark's resignation
content: The MLBPA has unanimously elected Bruce Meyer as its interim executive director following the resignation of Tony Clark.

title: ⛸️ Olympic skating costumes: Designs! Drama!
content: A bull, a building or a matador -- will Team USA's figure skating style win gold at the 2026 Winter Games? Learn more about fashion on the ice now.

title: 2026 Winter Olympics: U.S. women's hockey, Alysa Liu looking for gold and more
content: Thursday at the Olympics is headlined by the U.S. facing Canada for women's hockey gold and figure skater Alysa Liu looking to snap a 20-year U.S. drought.

title: 10 storylines that will define the summer: LeBron, Giannis, trade decisions and a loaded draft
content: How will teams such as the Lakers, Bucks, Warriors and Knicks attack the offseason? Here's everything Bobby Marks is watching.

title: Buster Olney on MLB's top first basemen: How high does Nick Kurtz rank?
content: Our top-10 rankings continue with a look at baseball's best first basemen, including the A's budding star.

title: UCL talking points: PSG's comeback win, Bodø/Glimt surprise Inter, more
content: The first legs of the UEFA Champions League knockout playoffs are in the books, and we have a lot to review.

title: Power Rankings: How the Terps returned to the top 16
content: After riding a four-game losing streak into February, the Terps have turned it around, winning four in a row.

title: Bracketology: Will Stanford miss the NCAA tournament again?
content: Teams with a high NET ranking are typically tournament locks. So why are the Huskers in the Last Four In?

title: Humility, charitable foundation keep Larry Fitzgerald grounded after HOF nod
content: "It's an amazing, amazing thing to be a Hall of Famer, but the light bill still came," Larry Fitzgerald said, keeping life in perspective.

title: 25 years after his death, Earnhardt's presence lives on in Daytona
content: It's been 25 years since Dale Earnhardt tragically died in Daytona, but a quarter century after his passing, his legacy lives large throughout NASCAR.

title: No Crosby, no problem? What we learned in Canada's thrilling 4-3 win over Czechia
content: The overwhelming tournament favorites needed a late tying goal and overtime to win, but they made the semis.

title: No union president -- in a CBA year? What's next for MLBPA after Clark shocker
content: With labor negotiations ahead, losing the union president is a shock. But the MLBPA has an opportunity to come out of this stronger.

title: How Premier League clubs are looking to the U.S. to raise transfer funds
content: With tighter financial regulations and rules on sponsors coming to the Premier League, clubs need new ways to raise cash. They're looking Stateside.

title: What players really think when a new boss arrives midseason
content: Nedum Onuoha reveals how players tend to react when their club changes its coach in the middle of the season.

title: 2027 recruiting intel: What you need to know about college football's next top prospects
content: It's recruiting season for the 2027 class. The QB market is wide open while playoff teams are out to flip five-stars.

title: Team USA's Hilary Knight and Brittany Bowe get engaged at the Olympics
content: Knight and Bowe fell in love at the 2022 Games and have brought their Olympic love story full circle.

title: Can anyone stop Messi's Miami from going back-to-back?
content: The 2026 MLS season begins this weekend! So what players and storylines will we need to keep an eye out for?

title: Nine tips to help you win your league
content: Nine tips to use during the fantasy baseball season, from trade strategies to how to value rookies and closers

title: Mario Barrios-Ryan Garcia: Picks, predictions, more
content: Two fighters and two trainers share their analysis and predictions for the Mario Barrios-Ryan Garcia title fight.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool look to Spurs' Bergvall
content: Liverpool are considering making a move for Tottenham Hotspur midfielder Lucas Bergvall. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: 'Makes your country stronger': French President Macron on criticism over Rafale deal in India
content: French President Emmanuel Macron defended the Rafale deal, stating it strengthens India's defense capabilities and strategic coordination. He emphasized France's commitment to increasing Indian components and manufacturing critical devices in India, including co-production of combat aircraft and maintenance. This comes as India's Defence Acquisition Council cleared the procurement of 114 Rafale fighter jets.

title: 'Epstein sent woman, Andrew sent confidential docs': What police is probing against ex-UK prince
content: UK Police are investigating Prince Andrew for alleged misconduct in public office, focusing on his links with convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. Allegations include Epstein sending a woman to the UK for a sexual encounter with Andrew in 2010 and the Prince sharing confidential trade documents with Epstein while serving as a trade envoy.

title: Indian visas in Bangladesh likely to be 'fully restored' soon as Rahman takes charge
content: India is set to "fully restore" its visa services in Bangladesh. This comes after a recent change in Bangladesh's political leadership. Aniruddha Das, a senior Indian consular official, confirmed the steps to fully restore services. Medical and double-entry visas are already being issued. Other categories, including travel visas, will also resume soon. This move signals a strengthening of India-Bangladesh relations.

title: Sikandar roars in Colombo: Zimbabwe stun Sri Lanka, fire warning shot at India
content: Riding on their captain Sikandar Raza’s brilliance, Zimbabwe cruised to an emphatic six-wicket win over co-hosts Sri Lanka. Chasing 178, Zimbabwe finished the job with three balls to spare, underlining their authority in the group stage, which they closed unbeaten, highlighted by victories over Sri Lanka and Australia.

title: Wake-up call for taxpayers: Foreign assets reporting in focus - what you should know
content: India’s foreign asset reporting regime has progressively aligned with global transparency standards, though its structural design differs from mature jurisdictions such as the United States.

title: AI summit: Google AI CEO cautions everyone about two biggest risks of artificial intelligence
content: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis has flagged two critical AI risks: malicious use of beneficial tech and unintended actions by autonomous systems. He urged global cooperation on minimum deployment standards, noting AI's borderless impact.

title: 'Bengal will have its fish & meat': State BJP chief refutes CM Mamata's claim
content: West Bengal BJP president Samik Bhattacharya clarified that the party opposes only the open sale of beef, not all non-vegetarian food. He asserted that people in Bengal are free to consume what they choose, refuting claims of a ban on fish and meat sales.

title: 'International cricket will expose you': Amir tears into Abhishek Sharma again
content: Pakistan pacer Mohammad Amir has issued a stark warning to India's Abhishek Sharma following his three consecutive ducks in the T20 World Cup 2026. Amir drew parallels to Saim Ayub's early struggles, emphasizing how quality bowlers exploit technical flaws.

title: What OpenAI CEO said about awkward moment with Anthropic CEO at India AI Summit
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman addressed an awkward onstage moment at the India AI Impact Summit 2026, where he and Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei appeared to hesitate during a group photo with Prime Minister Narendra Modi. Altman stated he was confused about the expected pose, mistaking it for an 'open clock' gesture.

title: Dwarka SUV crash: Victim's mother refuses to accept apology by accused teen's father
content: A 17-year-old's father apologized to the mother of a young man killed in a fatal Delhi crash, offering to abide by judicial decisions. The victim's mother, however, expressed disbelief at the delayed apology, questioning the accused's family's focus on bail over remorse. Police are investigating the father for allowing a minor to drive.

title: 'Rampant corruption': Congress releases '20-point chargesheet' against BJP govt in Assam
content: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra released a 20-point chargesheet against the BJP-led Assam government, accusing Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma of corruption and using state machinery to create fear among minorities. The Congress highlighted unfulfilled promises, including ST status for indigenous communities and increased wages for tea garden workers, ahead of the upcoming assembly elections.

title: Deadly thread in the sky: Why Chinese manjha remains a killer
content: Chinese manjha, a sharp synthetic kite string, poses a deadly threat during Indian festivals, causing severe injuries and fatalities to motorcyclists and birds. Despite government bans and enforcement drives, its illegal sale persists, turning a cherished tradition into a recurring public safety crisis.

title: Federal Reserve Governor agrees with one of the most-dangerous AI forecast
content: Federal Reserve Governor Michael S. Barr warns of a potential "jobless boom" driven by AI, where widespread automation could render a significant portion of the population unemployable. He outlined scenarios ranging from mass layoffs to a stalled AI industry, emphasizing the need for society to be nimble and bold in managing these potentially painful transitions.

title: How AI uncovered Rs 70,000 crore tax evasion scam starting with Hyderabad biryani chains
content: An Income Tax investigation into Hyderabad biryani chains uncovered a massive tax evasion scam across India's food and beverage industry. Analyzing 60 terabytes of data from a pan-India billing software, officials revealed suppressed sales turnover of at least Rs 70,000 crore since 2019-20. The probe identified deletion and under-reporting of cash transactions as key evasion tactics.

title: Mitch Marner’s OT winner fuels ‘Toronto bias’ debate
content: Mitch Marner scored the overtime winner in a 4-3 win for Team Canada over Czechia in the Olympic quarterfinals, leading to debate about his big-game reputation and the “Toronto bias” that is influencing criticism of him. The game featured plenty of scoring, with goals from Macklin Celebrini and Nathan MacKinnon, with Marner’s goal securing the win and sending Canada through to the semifinals against Finland.

title: 'Law must take its course': King Charles on arrest of his brother Andrew amid Epstein probe
content: King Charles III expressed deep concern and stated "the law must take its course" following the arrest of his brother, ex-prince Andrew, on suspicion of misconduct in public office. The investigation into allegations of sharing confidential trade documents with Jeffrey Epstein will proceed with full cooperation from the royal family.

title: King Charles 'not informed' in advance of ex-prince Andrew's arrest - what we know
content: Prince Andrew was arrested on suspicion of misconduct in public office on his 66th birthday, following alleged links to the Epstein Files. Thames Valley Police raided the Sandringham estate after emails and compromising photographs emerged from US Department of Justice releases. Prime Minister Keir Starmer stated no one is above the law.

title: Nifty50 ends below 25,500, Sensex down over 1,200 points - top reasons for crash
content: Stock market crash today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex tanked in trade on Thursday after three consecutive days of gains. While Nifty50 went below 25,450, BSE Sensex crashed over 1,400 points in intraday trade.

title: Mahua Moitra moves Delhi HC against ex-partner seeking custody of pet Rottweiler 'Henry'
content: TMC MP Mahua Moitra has approached the Delhi High Court seeking custody of her pet Rottweiler, Henry. The plea challenges a lower court's order that denied her monthly 10-day custody. The dispute with her ex-partner, Jai Anant Dehadrai, over the dog has escalated into public and legal confrontations.

title: Regina Cassandra calls out Bollywood double standards over bias
content: Actress Regina Cassandra has voiced concerns over Bollywood's double standards, revealing she faced prejudice due to her South Indian roots despite fluency in Hindi and prior film experience. She highlighted how regional identity and gender stereotypes impacted her treatment, calling for equal respect across all Indian film industries and demanding fair opportunities.

title: ‘Just bed and toilet’: No royal privileges for arrested ex-prince Andrew
content: Britain's former prince Andrew has been arrested on suspicion of misconduct in public office and faces no special treatment in custody, with experts stating he can be held for up to 96 hours. The arrest is linked to his association with convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, with revelations suggesting he shared confidential documents while serving as a trade envoy.

title: Ramadan 2026: When is first Roza in India? check Sehri and Iftar timings in Delhi
content: India observes the sacred month of Ramazan starting February 19, 2026, with Muslims fasting from dawn till dusk until March 19. This period involves prayer, charity, and community meals, culminating in the Eid-Al-Fitr celebration.  The article provides specific Sehri and Iftar timings for Delhi, Mumbai, and Hyderabad.

title: Thala for a reason? Shivam Dube credits 'Mahi bhai' after match-winning knock
content: Shivam Dube credited MS Dhoni's guidance for his improved batting approach, particularly against pace. Dhoni advised focusing on strike rotation and controlled intent, which Dube implemented effectively in India's T20 World Cup win against the Netherlands. Dube's match-winning 67-run knock and two wickets earned him player of the match honors.

title: 35 students found with wrist cuts in Chhattisgarh govt school; probe ordered
content: Alarm bells rang in Chhattisgarh's Dhamtari district after 35 students from a government middle school were found with healed cut marks on their wrists. The injuries, believed to be weeks old, surfaced after a parent's complaint. Preliminary investigations suggest peer imitation, with students using sharp objects, possibly influenced by a dare or social media trend.

title: Ex-prince Andrew arrested: What recent files revealed about his ties with Epstein
content: Prince Andrew was arrested on suspicion of misconduct in public office following new documents linking him to Jeffrey Epstein. These files include photographs and emails suggesting Andrew shared trade reports and discussed meetings with women. Several UK police forces are now reviewing material related to his association with the convicted sex offender.

title: Volkswagen Tayron R-Line launched at Rs 46.99 lakh: What makes it special
content: Features include a fully digital instrument cluster, a panoramic sunroof, customisable ambient lighting with up to 30 colour options, and Matrix LED lighting technology. In terms of practicality, the SUV offers up to 850 litres of boot space with the third row folded down. The Tayron is powered by a 2.0-litre, 4-cylinder, turbocharged petrol engine that produces 204 hp and 320 Nm of torque.

title: ‘My BP was 160’: How he left his job and built Rs 30 lakh farming venture
content: An engineer quit his high-paying IT job to pursue organic moringa farming in Haryana after lifestyle diseases impacted his health.  Jitender and Sarla Mann now run a successful business, earning ₹30 lakh annually from organic moringa products sold across India, the USA, and the UAE, emphasizing quality and chemical-free practices.

title: Britain's ex-prince Andrew arrested over misconduct amid Epstein row
content: Britain's Prince ex-Andrew has been arrested. He faces suspicion of misconduct in public office. This marks a significant development. The Duke of York has been living in Norfolk. Thames Valley Police confirmed the arrest. Searches are underway at multiple locations. The investigation is active. Prince Andrew has previously denied wrongdoing.

title: 'Appeasing policy': Why SC flagged 'freebies culture' and cautioned states
content: The Supreme Court expressed serious concerns over the growing culture of freebies in states, warning it could hamper economic development and strain finances. Justices questioned whether indiscriminate distribution of benefits, without distinguishing between the needy and others, amounts to an appeasing policy that could weaken work culture and development efforts.

title: 'Don't threaten people': Kerala BJP chief hits out at CM Vijayan over ‘The Kerala Story 2’
content: Kerala BJP chief Rajeev Chandrasekhar has accused Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan of hypocrisy and distraction tactics over his opposition to 'The Kerala Story' sequel. Chandrasekhar asserted filmmakers' rights and citizens' freedom to watch, urging Vijayan to use legal channels instead of creating fear. Vijayan had earlier condemned the sequel as a bid to spread communal discord.

title: Cardi B refuses Stefon Diggs’ attempts to reconnect after breakup
content: Stefon Diggs and Cardi B reportedly had a pretty dramatic break up as the New England Patriots' star player lost miserably at Super Bowl LX. As Cardi B seems to be busy touring the country, a new claim has been made about Stefon Diggs trying his best to win her back. But Cardi B has reacted pretty strongly to it.

title: Rajpal Yadav opens up about playing 500 roles and his strict no-abuse rule on screen
content: Actor Rajpal Yadav, known for his comic roles and honest reflections, discussed his career evolution and principles in a past interview. He emphasized his commitment to clean humor, shunning abusive language despite industry trends. Currently facing legal issues from a cheque bounce case, Yadav's past statements highlight his resilience and dedication to his craft.

title: Nikhil Gupta, Pannun murder plot and the Nijjar connection: Inside a case that spanned 3 continents
content: Hardeep Singh Nijjar, a Khalistani separatist, was assassinated in Canada, sparking diplomatic tensions. Simultaneously, a plot to kill Gurpatwant Singh Pannun in the US was uncovered, leading to the arrest of Indian national Nikhil Gupta. US authorities allege an Indian government employee directed the plot, a claim India disputes, suggesting a rogue operation.

title: Emirates Mars Mission: UAE extends Hope Probe until 2028, new discoveries expected
content: The United Arab Emirates has extended its Emirates Mars Mission, the Hope Probe, through 2028, significantly beyond its original two-year operational timeline. This extension allows for continued study of Martian weather and atmospheric dynamics, contributing valuable data to global climate research and bolstering the UAE's growing space sector and future deep-space ambitions.

title: Bangladesh skies closed for SpiceJet: Here's why airline is barred by Dhaka
content: Bangladesh has barred SpiceJet from its airspace over unpaid dues, forcing the airline to reroute flights from Kolkata to northeastern cities like Guwahati.  While SpiceJet assures constructive engagement for resolution, the extended flight paths are impacting operations. This comes as the budget carrier recently reported a significant quarterly loss.

title: 'India used to fear us': Pakistan's Amir, Ali blast Shadab for digs at seniors
content: Mohammad Amir said Pakistan no longer commands the fear it did in the 1990s, especially against India. Shahid Afridi called for dropping senior players, which angered Shadab Khan, who reminded critics they also never beat India in World Cups. Basit Ali criticised Shadab’s comments and questioned his performances, sharing an anecdote about taking away his phones on a past tour.

title: ‘Expectations weighing him down’: Gavaskar reveals how Abhishek can survive T20 WC test
content: Cricket legend Sunil Gavaskar believes pressure is affecting India's young opening batter Abhishek Sharma's T20 World Cup form, advising him to build his innings patiently rather than forcing big shots early.  He also praised Shivam Dube's explosive batting and highlighted Varun Chakravarthy's crucial role as a key bowler for India.

title: Rajasthan: Man detained for threatening to 'shoot' Rahul Gandhi & 25 other Congress MPs
content: A man identifying as a Karni Sena spokesperson was detained in Kota for allegedly uploading a video threatening to shoot Rahul Gandhi and 25 other Congress MPs. The threats were issued over alleged verbal abuse of Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla. Both BJP and Karni Sena have denied any association with the accused.

title: At AI Summit, PM Modi’s nameplate carries a ‘Bharat’ message
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi urged the global community at the AI Impact Summit to leverage technological disruption as humanity's greatest opportunity, emphasizing "right action" guided by "right understanding." The summit also saw the country's nameplate displayed as "Bharat," a recurring practice at official global events, sparking renewed discussion.

title: From Gerald R Ford to INS Vikramaditya: A look at the world’s 10 biggest aircraft carriers
content: Aircraft carriers are powerful mobile airbases crucial for naval strategy, projecting power, and supporting diverse missions. From the technologically advanced USS Gerald R. Ford to the UK's Queen Elizabeth-class and Russia's Admiral Kuznetsov, these vessels showcase global naval capabilities and evolving designs.

title: Gold price today: Check rates of 18K, 22K and 24K gold in your city
content: Gold prices saw an upward trend on Thursday, with the April futures contract climbing Rs 365 to Rs 1,56,126 per 10 grams. This rise was fueled by fresh speculator buying and strong spot demand. Globally, New York gold futures also gained, reflecting a positive market sentiment.

title: Karachi gas explosion: 16 dead, several injured after illegal building collapse
content: A devastating gas explosion ripped through a residential building in Karachi's Soldier Bazaar early this morning, claiming at least 16 lives, including women and children. The blast caused a partial collapse of the ground-plus-two-storey structure, trapping victims under debris. Rescue efforts are underway, with authorities investigating the cause of the tragedy amidst ongoing concerns about building safety in the city.

title: On India's Wishlist, Independent AI With Full Control, "Kill Switch"
content: AI will soon sit at the core of how a nation governs, heals, teaches, feeds and delivers justice to its citizens.

title: Thai Cops Go Undercover As Lion Dancers To Catch Thief Who Stole Buddhist Items
content: Thai police donned a lion dance costume during this week's Lunar New Year festivities to arrest a suspect accused of stealing about $64,000 worth of Buddhist artefacts, police said Thursday.

title: Andrew To Princess Anne: Royals Who Have Faced Fines, Trials, And Executions
content: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor, the former Duke of York and brother of King Charles, has been arrested on suspicion of misconduct in public office.

title: OpenAI CEO Says AI Regulation 'Urgently' Needed At India Summit
content: The world urgently needs to regulate artificial intelligence, OpenAI head Sam Altman said on Thursday at a summit in New Delhi on the risks and opportunities posed by the fast-evolving technology.

title: Russia Calls On Iran To "Exercise Restraint" Amid US Military Buildup
content: Russia called for restraint on Thursday amid growing tensions over a possible US attack on Iran, and as Moscow and Tehran staged naval drills that the Kremlin said were scheduled and should not be a cause for alarm.

title: 'India Needed For Peace, Development': UN Human Rights Chief To NDTV
content: With more than 70 countries participating and over 300,000 people attending, the summit has become one of the largest global gatherings focused on AI.

title: 'Possibility Of Conflict Real': Poland PM Calls For Poles To Leave Iran
content: Prime Minister Donald Tusk called on Thursday for all Polish citizens to leave Iran, after US President Donald Trump again hinted at military action against the Islamic republic.

title: Andrew Arrested Over Epstein Files, But Cops Won't Name Him. UK Law Explained
content: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor has been arrested in the UK on suspicion of misconduct in public office, and also amid allegations that he had links with convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Former UK Royal Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor Arrested: A Timeline Of Controversies
content: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor, the second son of late Queen Elizabeth II, has been at the centre of scandals for decades.

title: At India AI Summit, Jeet Adani Says AI Will Redefine Sovereignty
content: India must architect its own artificial intelligence (AI) infrastructure rather than rely on imports, Adani Group executive director Jeet Adani said on Thursday, warning that AI will redefine national sovereignty.

title: Bangladesh Bars SpiceJet From Using Airspace Over Unpaid Dues
content: Budget carrier SpiceJet has been barred from using Bangladesh's airspace over pending air navigation charges, forcing the airline to reroute certain flights and potentially raising fuel costs.

title: PM Modi, Abu Dhabi Crown Prince Hold Bilateral Talks At India AI Summit
content: The Crown Prince of Abu Dhabi, Sheikh Khaled bin Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan, held a bilateral meeting with Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday, being part of the 20 world leaders who were invited for the AI Impact Summit 2026.

title: Former UK Royal Andrew Arrested Amid Probe Into Epstein Ties
content: Former Prince Andrew has been arrested at his temporary home, the Sandringham estate, on suspicion of misconduct in public office, according to reports. The Thames Valley Police said on Thursday that the ex-royal is in custody.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Delhi Scorpio Tragedy: Why These Four States Top The Hit-And-Run List
content: The share of hit-and-run cases in total road fatalities has expanded from roughly 13-14% to nearly 18%, indicating that fleeing the scene has become a pattern in a growing proportion of fatal crashes.

title: "Interference In Religious Affairs": Omar Abdullah's Party On Ramzan Charity Order
content: A political row has erupted in Jammu and Kashmir after the administration in Kishtwar district ordered regulating charity collections during the month of Ramzan.

title: India's 3rd Nuclear Ballistic Missile Submarine To Enter Service Soon
content: India's nuclear deterrent has got a big boost with the country's third nuclear-powered ballistic missile submarine (SSBN) INS Aridhaman set to enter service in April-May this year.

title: AI Cold War On Stage: OpenAI, Anthropic CEOs' Awkward Moment At Delhi Summit
content: A light-hearted yet widely noticed awkward moment unfolded during the group photograph at the India AI Impact Summit in New Delhi today, as OpenAI CEO Sam Altman and Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei chose raised fists instead of holding hands.

title: What Is Navitaire, And Why A Glitch Grounded Flights Across India?
content: During the outage, airlines such as IndiGo, Akasa Air, and Air India Express had to process passenger details manually.

title: AI Summit 2026 LIVE Updates, Day 4: PM Modi Addresses AI Impact Summit
content: AI Impact Summit 2026 LIVE Updates: Prime Minister Narendra Modi addressed global leaders at India AI Impact Summit 2026 and called to democratise artificial intelligence.

title: A.P. CM Naidu to attend India AI Impact Summit in Delhi
content: The State government is expected to sign key agreements to strengthen AI infrastructure and promote large-scale skill development

title: New proposal to widen the NH in Kottayam
content: Project worth ₹150 crore has been proposed to upgrade a section from Aida Junction to Mannathipara in Kottayam, expanding the road to a width of 10 m in accordance with modern standards

title: State has 22.30 lakh free farm power connections, says Energy Minister Gottipati Ravi Kumar
content: As many as 1,02,538 new free agricultural power connections have been sanctioned across the three Discoms since formation of the NDA government in 2024, he says, adding that the government has set a target of generating 4,000 MW of solar power by 2030

title: ‘Mobile bidi pustaka hidi’ campaign to be launched in Karnataka to inculcate reading habit among schoolchildren
content: The objective of the campaign is to systematically develop a love for reading among students to shape them into responsible citizens with active, rational and high-level thinking skills

title: NLCIL pays dividend of ₹360 crore to Coal Ministry
content: Better operational parameters, cost optimisation measures and disciplined capital allocation have contributed significantly to the company’s improved financial performance, says NLCIL CMD

title: Njeliyanparamba’s legacy waste to be cleared, 12.6 acres to be recovered
content: A significant portion of the recovered land will be handed over to Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited for the establishment of a modern compressed biogas plant

title: Freeze ‘mango’ symbol, urges PMK founder Ramadoss before Madras High Court
content: PMK founder S. Ramadoss insists on issuing a direction to Election Commission to not notify the Assembly elections in Tamil Nadu and Puducherry until the disposal of his writ petition

title: Shivaji Jayanti celebrated with fervour
content: Colourful processions with portraits and statues of Shivaji Maharaj mounted on embellished vehicles were taken out on the thoroughfares of the villages, towns, and cities to mark the occasion.

title: Buffer zones in Manipur may need to continue where wounds of violence remain deep: Deputy CM Nemcha Kipgen
content: As the Northeastern State’s first woman Deputy CM, Ms. Kipgen says that like ‘a caring mother nurtures a peaceful home, she would like to carry forward this essence of care and responsibility in serving the people of Manipur’; on protests that broke out after she took charge, she points out that while she ‘respects those emotions, the decision was taken in good faith and with a sense of long-term responsibility, not personal ambition’

title: Maharashtra CM Fadnavis lauds Gadchiroli police for removing last visible symbols of Maoist terror
content: This action reflects the government’s unwavering commitment to restoring peace, strengthening security and accelerating development in the region, Fadnavis said

title: ECI asks 18 States, 4 UTs to prepare for next phase of SIR expected in April
content: Election Commission of India on February 19, asked 18 States, 4 UTs to complete preparatory work related to the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) at the earliest

title: New AI-focussed courses soon at Chokli govt. college: Minister
content: The government ushers in innovative changes in higher education through infrastructure development and curriculum reforms, says Higher Education Minister R. Bindu

title: SHRC registers suo motu case over poor facilities at taluk hospital
content: The Commission asks the Director of Health Services and the District Medical Officer to conduct an investigation into the matter

title: Why did DMK not take up State autonomy while sharing power in Centre: Palaniswami
content: He accuses the ruling party of raising the issue only for the Assembly election and charged that it was raking up the issue only to blame the BJP

title: U.S. returnee stages house break-in drama to cover up gold theft
content: A B.Tech graduate who discontinued his masters, the accused was stealing gold ornaments belonging to his grandmother and other family members since 2024

title: Crackdown on illegal flex boards in Mysuru
content: The DC orders the immediate removal of unauthorised flex boards and banners, and warns of legal action in case of failure to act

title: CPI(M) opposes ‘15-fold hike’ in electricity duty on small industries
content: The per-unit rise to ₹1 from the existing 6 paise further aggravates the problems of entrepreneurs, who are already reeling under the impact of true-up charges and mounting losses, says CPI(M) State secretary Srinivasa Rao

title: First phase of Wayanad landslide rehab township to be inaugurated on February 25
content: In the first phase, 178 houses will be handed over to the survivors. Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan says 327 beneficiaries will be provided land and houses before the next monsoon season, ensuring complete rehabilitation

title: Rajnath Singh invites ASEAN countries to benefit from India’s defence technology
content: The Defence Minister describes ASEAN as a central pillar of India’s Indo-Pacific strategy, emphasising that shared security is the foundation of regional prosperity

title: Kerala State Sports department aims to send 250 athletes to 2036 Olympics under Olympic Path scheme: Kerala Sports Minister V. Abdurahiman
content: As many as 5,000 children will be identified at grassroots level across various disciplines and provided with systematic training. They will compete in major events, including National Games, Asian Games, and Commonwealth Games, with the best 250 groomed for participation in Olympics, says Minister

title: Kuthiravattom mental health centre plagued by security concerns
content: The centre at present has only five security staff instead of the required 20. At least 10 people are reported to have quit the job in the past one-and-a-half months alone

title: Sale of adulterated coconut oil: farmers elated over SHRC’s intervention
content: The Commission sought a report from the Food Safety Commissioner in 15 days and the case would be considered in the next adalat in Kozhikode district

title: Netherlands PM Dick Schoof to visit Traffic Management Centre in Bengaluru on Friday to review ASTraM
content: He will be visiting the city to review ASTraM, a tech-driven approach to analysing and managing Bengaluru city traffic, developed in collaboration with a Dutch company

title: In a first, Shia body in Kashmir collaborates with IMD on Ramzan moon sighting
content: In the past, Kashmir has many times aligned with announcements made by Ruet-e-Hilal Committees in Pakistan and Iran on moon sighting to start Ramzan or observe the festivals of Eid

title: Anbumani criticises DMK government for not revising autorickshaw, taxi fares
content: He points out that costs have risen but the fares have remained unchanged since 2013, affecting the livelihoods of drivers

title: State contractors’ association to hold strike over pending bills on March 6
content: State president of the association R. Manjunath says the government has not cleared dues amounting to ₹37,370 crore, pending in various departments

title: State-level meeting on Census-2027 at Secretariat on February 20
content: It will focus on various aspects, including planning, coordination mechanisms and training arrangements

title: Iconic tusker Padayappa tests nerves in Munnar
content: The beloved elephant of the tea hills is again on a destructive spree during musth, attacking vehicles along forest routes. Even as concerns rise among travellers, plantation workers and wildlife groups defend the ageing tusker as a seasonal wanderer, not a conflict animal.

title: Congress slams death threat to Rahul Gandhi, blames ‘toxic’ BJP-RSS discourse
content: ‘Self-proclaimed Modi bhakts’ are brazenly issuing death threats against Rahul Gandhi in broad daylight — without any reprimand from the ruling regime, says party general secretary K.C. Venugopal

title: Hubballi: File special leave petition against High Court order allowing bike taxis, say driver unions to government
content: Allowing unauthorised bike taxis would not only endanger public safety but also increase the number of road accidents, they say.

title: ‘Assamese community’ will become almost minority in 2027 Census: Himanta
content: "During 2027 Census, the Assamese community will become almost a minority," the Assam Chief Minister Himanta Sarma told the State Assembly without elaborating

title: Watch: AI cannot be left to ‘whims of a few billionaires’: UN chief Antonio Guterres
content: United Nations chief Antonio Guterres has warned that the future of artificial intelligence must not be left to “the whims of a few billionaires” as he addressed a global AI summit in India.

title: Lakhbir Landa gang claims responsibility for AAP sarpanch's murder in Punjab’s Tarn Taran
content: In the unverified post that surfaced on social media on Thursday (February 19), the Lakhbir Landa gang claimed it was behind Harbarinder Singh's killing.

title: Karnataka enters Ranji Trophy final, to face Jammu and Kashmir in title clash
content: Following their success in the 2013-14 season, Karnataka grabbed the Ranji, Irani and Vijay Hazare trophies in the 2014-15 season as well

title: BJP MLA from Kurseong joins Trinamool
content: Bishnu Prasad Sharma, who had been publicly critical of the BJP for quite some time now, wields considerable influence in the Gorkhaland region

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Traditional knowledge docketing system among proposals in draft Kerala Intellectual Property Rights Policy
content: The IPR policy is being revised after 18 years. While 2008 IPR policy sought to lay a ‘foundational vision’ for democratising innovation and safeguarding community-held knowledge, the 2026 revision attempts to build on this legacy, responding to the shifts in global trade, digital transformation and biodiversity governance

title: Woman booked for misusing bank account in ₹70.85 lakh cyber fraud case
content: The Karnataka Cyber Command has intensified its statewide special drive against mule bank accounts and “mule herders,” uncovering a large network involved in routing proceeds of cyber fraud across the State

title: ‘Unresolved boundary’ between India and China causing difficulties in relations: General Naravane
content: Speaking at a literature festival in Dibrugarh, the former Army chief says it is possible to arrive at an agreement through negotiations over the boundary issue with China similar to the 2015 Land Boundary Agreement signed with Bangladesh; he emphasises that India will never tolerate ‘unilateral use of force’ by China along the Line of Actual Control (LAC)

title: Chander Kunj apartment owners resist move by army housing forum to opt out of tripartite agreements for appointing consultant, demolition contractor
content: Army Welfare Housing Organisation and Chander Kunj Army Towers Apartment  Owners Association clash over more issues, including green building and swimming pool matters

title: Bengaluru woman rescued by police seconds before drowning in Bellandur Lake
content: The 23-year-old woman called the emergency helpline Namma 112 stating that she intended to end her life due to distress caused by frequent domestic disputes with her husband, a water-tanker driver.

title: Karnataka RTC staff protest: Bus services 96% normal, says government
content: Of the 12,458 scheduled departures planned across KSRTC, BMTC, NWKRTC and KKRTC, 11,987 services were operated, achieving an overall operation rate of 96.22%.

title: Animal part in soft drink causes health scare in Tiruchi college
content: According to reports, the incident took place at the canteen of a government college in Tiruchi when the male students shared a bottle of the soft drink, and found what appeared to be the tail of a skink in the dregs

title: Man detained in Kota for threatening to shoot Rahul Gandhi, other Congress MPs
content: Kota Superintendent of Police (SP) Tejaswani Gautam told PTI that police took suo motu action and detained the accused at Borkheda police station

title: Srisailam gears up for Ugadi
content: While the festivities will start on March 16, devotees will start arriving to the temple town from the first week of March itself, the EO said

title: Delhi High Court seeks Kuldeep Sengar's stand on Unnao rape survivor's plea in custodial death case
content: A Bench of justices Navin Chawla and Ravinder Dudeja issued notice to Sengar and other convicts on the survivor's plea seeking condonation of a delay of over 1940 days in filing the appeal against the 2020 trial court order on conviction and sentencing.

title: Demands for bus stands, memorial buildings raised in T.N. Assembly
content: The Minister was responding to a question raised by Manithaneya Makkal Katchi leader and Papanasam MLA M.H. Jawahirullah, who demanded the construction of a bus stand at Ayyampettai and also at Swamimalai, one of the six abodes of Lord Muruga

title: Kerala ruling front and Opposition close ranks against film ‘The Kerala Story 2’
content: The opposing political fronts have unanimously condemned the controversial movie as one that brazenly advances Sangh Parivar’s Hindu majoritarian agenda by demonising minorities, chiefly Muslims

title: Supreme Court to hear CAA petitions from May 5
content: Final hearing in Citizenship (Amendment) Act case to begin May 5; over 250 petitions challenge CAA and Rules

title: Damage to steel crash barrier raises safety concerns among motorists near Mutharasanallur
content: Hundreds of vehicles use this stretch of the busy Tiruchi-Karur Highway and railways had installed the steel barrier for about 1 km as a safety measure several years ago

title: Supreme Court refuses to entertain plea for SIR of electoral rolls in poll-bound Assam
content: The PIL, filed by Mrinal Kumar Choudhary, challenged the EC's decision to conduct a standard Special Revision in Assam instead of the more rigorous SIR conducted in other States.

title: Watch: Tamil Nadu’s women paradox: Educated, but not employed? | Focus Tamil Nadu
content: Tamil Nadu has one of the highest rates of women’s education in India. The State leads in healthcare, financial inclusion, and even has all-women factories in the automobile and electric vehicle sectors. And yet, only about 1 in 3 educated women are employed. How can both realities exist at the same time?

title: Provide basic amenities to evicted people: Gauhati High Court tells Assam govt.
content: A total of 566 families have been living in a makeshift camp since their eviction in June 2025 from Hasila Beel in western Assam’s Goalpara district

title: From silence to statement: India’s stand on Israel’s West Bank actions
content: India has added its name to the list of countries criticising Israel for its unilateral measures on the West Bank.

title: Congress takes dig at PM Modi’s ‘MANAV’ vision for AI
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday (February 19, 2026) unveiled the MANAV vision for a human-centric approach and use of the fast-emerging technology with emphasis on sovereignty and inclusivity

title: Tobacco farmers protest sharp fall in prices, auctions suspended in few places in Karnataka
content: Anticipating a dip in sales after the 40% tax hike, cigarette manufacturers are believed to have curtailed purchases, leading to price volatility

title: Watch: Sundar Pichai sips 'Bharat GI' coffee; what is 'world exclusive' initiative

title: 'I'd rather retire': Caitlin Clark reacts to LeBron James giving up cookies and wine
content: leBron James says he just wants to live and doesn't know if he'll play for a 24th season . the los Angeles lakers star said he would abstain from desserts and alcohol altogether . he revealed that once the month ended, he decided to continue the fast through December .

title: Olympics men's hockey daily: Semifinal matchups are set
content: three out of four quarterfinal matchups in the 2026 Olympic men's hockey tournament went to overtime . the top four seeds all move on, with both semifinal games scheduled for Friday . no. 1 seed Canada vs. No. 4 seed Finland, 10:40 a.m. OT winner sends U.S. into hockey semis .

title: How to bet the Genesis Invitational: What to look for in the return to Riviera
content: the Genesis Invitational is back at Riviera Country Club after last year's detour to Torrey Pines . I'm targeting players who can create birdie looks with approach shots, save themselves when they miss the greens and actually capitalize on momentum . most top 20s are juiced, and I rarely step into Top 10 unless there is a real ceiling case .

title: Here's how the NBA can fix its tanking problem -- and incentivize teams to win
content: the Indiana Pacers are in the nation's capital to face the Washington Wizards . Ivica Zubac has yet to play a game for the club . he remains out with an ankle injury that was announced by coach Rick Carlisle .

title: Men's Power Rankings: A 1-2 showdown on tap this weekend!
content: Michigan vs. Duke on Saturday has been circled on calendars of men's college hoops diehards . both teams ranked in the preseason top 10 . it's no. 1 in six of seven NCAA team sheet metrics, ranking no. 2 in the BPI .

title: Three A's, a whole lot of B's and one F. Final offseason grades for all 30 teams
content: the world baseball Classic is just around the corner . it has been an interesting offseason with some impact trades, some surprising free agent signings and, of course, every team improving . let's find out who the big winners are: AL East: BAL | BOS | NYY | TB | TOR AL Central: CHW | CLE | DET | KC | MIN AL West: ATH | HOU | LAA | NYM | PHI | WSH NL Central: CHC | C

title: USA vs. Canada is the women's hockey rematch everyone was waiting for
content: the only two teams that have won gold are the united states and canada . the rest of the world is starting to catch up, with emerging programs from Sweden, Czechia and even Switzerland . team USA is the overwhelming favorite, but dynamics can change anytime there's a gold medal on the line.

title: Fly high, free bird! Postgame takeaways, grades and more from Team USA's OT thriller
content: two of the first three quarterfinal games of the 2026 Olympic men's hockey tournament went to overtime . team USA entered the event with the second-best gold medal odds, behind canada . Quinn Hughes scored a game-winning goal in 3-on-3 overtime to advance to the semifinal round .

title: Grocery store owner arrested for killing elderly woman to rob her gold chain
content: a 43-year-old man has been arrested for killing his neighbour to rob her gold chain . the victim, Shobha, 68, waira, 69, was robbed by a police officer . he was arrested in the death of his neighbour, a man who killed her .
